author: T Madhavan
text:
Bharathi the labrador will return to GRP station that she guarded

Bharathi, the pet dog that went missing from the Government Railway Police (GRP) station in Tambaram, has been found.

A man who found the two-and-half-year-old labrador, which had been missing for eleven days, alerted the GRP at Tambaram

GRP Inspector S. Sekar, to whom the the labrador belongs, said the dog was with K. Selvam, a resident of Velachery, who found it. The dog is expected to be brought back to the station, which it used to guard, on Wednesday.

Speaking to The Hindu, Mr. Sekar, who was in Ramanathapuram, said the dog was sitting next to Mr. Selvam when he was returning home on an EMU train from M.M. Nagar. He took the dog home as it got attached to him during the journey. He said his family had also become fond of the dog. And it was Mr. Selvam’s daughter who alerted him about the missing dog after seeing media reports about it.

Two years ago, Mr. Sekar found the dog at the Perambur railway station; he thanked the media for the way they helped him get back his pet dog.

K. Selvam, a Velachery resident, found the two-and-half-year-old labrador, and alerted the GRP station in Tambaram
title: Homecoming awaits dog that went missing from GRP station
